posts.content:
So I was looking at some of the info on the legendary level system used by Kharlindale and I might have to go try that server.

In order to take PM levels, you have to have 20 wizard/sorc levels and if you have 15+ PM levels by lvl 40, then all your legendary levels are PM levels.  

So 20 + 15 gives me 35 levels that leaves 5 levels to add a tumble class, or 4 levels to get to undispellability and 1 level for a lvl 37 tumble class skill dump.

Anyone here ever play on Kharlindale and use a high level wizard/PM?   and if so, whats your favorite build?  
Or is it not worth it and I should just stick with a high level wizard  like a wiz 37/ Ftr 2/ Rogue 1  with EDR3   

Just for reference, here are the  PM changes for Kharlindale

And how their Legendary levels (41-60) affect PM's
"Palemaster - Improved undead summons (every 5th level), improved Necromancy DC's, increased damage for Negative Energy Ray and Negative Energy Blast, and improved Corpse Explosion (radius, damage, and uses/rest)."

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Now, if there's ever been an incentive to play a PM/caster, the mere mention of "Improved Corpse Explosion" has to be it - but is it the corpse or the explosion that's improved? Not a helpful response, but what do you expect from the likes of me?

posts.content:
From my understanding, after reading on their site, its the corpse that explodes and the higher your level the bigger the Boom....

"There should have been an earth-shattering Kaboooom....."

Though the DM says you have to learn to do it fast as the corpses don't stick around for long..
